verses.verse: Then the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Go<WH935> in unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, and tell<WH1696> him<WH559>, Thus says the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of the Hebrews<WH5680>, Let my people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, that they may serve me<WH5647>.
For if you refuse<WH3986> to let them go<WH7971>, and will hold them still<WH2388>,

Behold<WH3027>, the hand of the Lord<WH3068> is<WH1961> upon your cattle<WH4735> which is in the field<WH7704>, upon the horses<WH5483>, upon the donkeys<WH2543>, upon the camels<WH1581>, upon the oxen<WH1241>, and upon the sheep<WH6629>: there shall be a very<WH3966> severe<WH3515> pestilence<WH1698>.

And the Lord<WH3068> shall sever<WH6395> between the cattle<WH4735> of Israel<WH3478> and the cattle<WH4735> of Egypt<WH4714>: and there shall nothing<WH1697> die<WH4191> of all that is the children<WH1121>'s of Israel<WH3478>.
And the Lord<WH3068> appointed<WH7760> a set time<WH4150>, saying<WH559>, To morrow<WH4279> the Lord<WH3068> shall do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> in the land<WH776>.

And the Lord<WH3068> did<WH6213> that thing<WH1697> on the morrow<WH4283>, and all the cattle<WH4735> of Egypt<WH4714> died<WH4191>: but of the cattle<WH4735> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> died<WH4191> not one<WH259>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> sent<WH7971>, and<WH259>, behold, there was not one of the cattle<WH4735> of the Israelites<WH3478> dead<WH4191>. And the heart<WH3820> of Pharaoh<WH6547> was hardened<WH3513>, and he did not let the people<WH5971> go<WH7971>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872> and unto Aaron<WH175>, Take<WH3947> to you handfuls<WH2651> of ashes<WH6368> of the furnace<WH3536>, and let Moses<WH4872> sprinkle<WH2236> it toward the heaven<WH8064> in the sight<WH5869> of Pharaoh<WH6547>.

And it shall become small dust<WH80> in all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and shall be a boil<WH7822> breaking forth<WH6524> with boils<WH76> upon man<WH120>, and upon animal<WH929>, throughout all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

And they took<WH3947> ashes<WH6368> of the furnace<WH3536>, and stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547>; and Moses<WH4872> sprinkled<WH2236> it up toward heaven<WH8064>; and it became a boil<WH7822> breaking forth<WH6524> with boils<WH76> upon man<WH120>, and upon animal<WH929>.

And the magicians<WH2748> could<WH3201> not stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> Moses<WH4872> because<WH6440> of the boils<WH7822>; for the boil<WH7822> was upon the magicians<WH2748>, and upon all the Egyptians<WH4714>.
And the Lord<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> the heart<WH3820> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, and he listened<WH8085> not unto them<WH3068>; as the Lord had spoken<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Rise up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and stand<WH3320> before<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547>, and say<WH559> unto him<WH559>, Thus says the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of the Hebrews<WH5680>, Let my people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, that they may serve me<WH5647>.

For I will at this time<WH6471> send<WH7971> all my plagues<WH4046> upon your heart<WH3820>, and upon your servants<WH5650>, and upon your people<WH5971>; that you may know<WH3045> that there is none like me in all the earth<WH776>.
For now I will stretch out<WH7971> my hand<WH3027>, that I may strike<WH5221> you and your people<WH5971> with pestilence<WH1698>; and you shall be cut off<WH3582> from the earth<WH776>.

And in very<WH199> deed<WH5668> for this cause have I raised you up<WH5975>, for to show<WH7200> in you my power<WH3581>; and that my name<WH8034> may be declared<WH5608> throughout all the earth<WH776>.
As yet exalt<WH5549> you yourself against my people<WH5971>, that you will not let them go<WH7971>?

Behold<WH4279>, to morrow about this time<WH6256> I will cause it to rain<WH4305> a very<WH3966> severe<WH3515> hail<WH1259>, such as has not been<WH3644> in Egypt<WH4714> since<WH4480> the foundation there even until now<WH3117>.

Send<WH7971> therefore now<WH5756>, and gather your cattle<WH4735>, and all that you have in the field<WH7704>; for upon every man<WH120> and animal<WH929> which shall be found<WH4672> in the field<WH7704>, and shall not be brought<WH622> home<WH1004>, the hail<WH1259> shall come down<WH3381> upon them<WH4191>, and they shall die.
He that feared<WH3373> the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> among the servants<WH5650> of Pharaoh<WH6547> made his servants<WH5650> and his cattle<WH4735> flee<WH5127> into the houses<WH1004>:
And he that regarded<WH7760> not the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> left<WH5800> his servants<WH5650> and his cattle<WH4735> in the field<WH7704>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Stretch forth<WH5186> your hand<WH3027> toward heaven<WH8064>, that there may be hail<WH1259> in all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, upon man<WH120>, and upon animal<WH929>, and upon every herb<WH6212> of the field<WH7704>, throughout the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

And Moses<WH4872> stretched forth<WH5186> his rod<WH4294> toward heaven<WH8064>: and the Lord<WH3068> sent<WH5414> thunder<WH6963> and hail<WH1259>, and the fire<WH784> ran along<WH1980> upon the ground<WH776>; and the Lord<WH3068> rained<WH4305> hail<WH1259> upon the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

So there was hail<WH1259>, and fire<WH784> mingled<WH8432> with the hail<WH1259>, very<WH3966> severe<WH3515>, such as there was none<WH3808> like it in all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> since it became a nation<WH1471>.

And the hail<WH1259> struck<WH5221> throughout all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> all that was in the field<WH7704>, both man<WH120> and animal<WH929>; and the hail<WH1259> struck<WH5221> every herb<WH6212> of the field<WH7704>, and broke<WH7665> every tree<WH6086> of the field<WH7704>.
Only in the land<WH776> of Goshen<WH1657>, where the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> were<WH1259>, was there no hail.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> sent<WH7971>, and called<WH7121> for Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, and said<WH559> unto them<WH2398>, I have sinned this time<WH6471>: the Lord<WH3068> is righteous<WH6662>, and I and my people<WH5971> are wicked<WH7563>.

entreat<WH6279> the Lord<WH3068> (for it is enough<WH7227>) that there be no more mighty<WH430> thunderings<WH6963> and hail<WH1259>; and I will let you go<WH7971>, and you shall stay<WH5975> no longer<WH3254>.

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto him<WH3318>, As soon as I am gone out of the city<WH5892>, I will spread abroad<WH6566> my hands<WH3709> unto the Lord<WH3068>; and the thunder<WH6963> shall cease<WH2308>, neither shall there be any more hail<WH1259>; that you may know<WH3045> how that the earth<WH776> is the Lord<WH3068>'s.
But as for you and your servants<WH5650>, I know<WH3045> that you will not yet fear<WH3372> the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430>.
And the flax<WH6594> and the barley<WH8184> was struck<WH5221>: for the barley<WH8184> was in the ear<WH24>, and the flax<WH6594> was blooming<WH1392>.
But the wheat<WH2406> and the rie<WH3698> were not struck<WH5221>: for they<WH2007> were not grown up<WH648>.

And Moses<WH4872> went out<WH3318> of the city<WH5892> from Pharaoh<WH6547>, and spread abroad<WH6566> his hands<WH3709> unto the Lord<WH3068>: and the thunders<WH6963> and hail<WH1259> ceased<WH2308>, and the rain<WH4306> was not poured<WH5413> upon the earth<WH776>.

And when Pharaoh<WH6547> saw<WH7200> that the rain<WH4306> and the hail<WH1259> and the thunders<WH6963> were ceased<WH2308>, he sinned<WH2398> yet more<WH3254>, and hardened<WH3513> his heart<WH3820>, he and his servants<WH5650>.
And the heart<WH3820> of Pharaoh<WH6547> was hardened<WH2388>, neither would he let the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971>; as the Lord<WH3068> had spoken<WH1696> by<WH3027> Moses<WH4872>.
